capabilities.description: Netdata is able to change file ownership arbitrarily
capabilities.name: CHOWN

capabilities.description: Netdata is able to bypass file permission checks
capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE

capabilities.description: Netdata is able to bypass permission checks for file operations
capabilities.name: FOWNER

capabilities.name: SETGID

capabilities.name: SETUID

capabilities.name: SYS_PTRACE

capabilities.name: SYS_RAWIO

run_as_context.description: Netdata runs as a root user.

attrs.label: Enable SMART
attrs.description:
Enabling this will add the smartmontools package to the container.</br>
Note: You still need to pass disks to the container in the Devices section

attrs.label: Enable Intel GPU
attrs.description:
Enabling this will add the intel-gpu-tools package to the container.</br>
Note: You still need to pass the GPU to the container in the Resources section

attrs.label: Devices
attrs.description:
Devices to use.</br>
Eg: Host Device: /dev/sda, Container Device: /dev/dsa

attrs.label: Additional Deb Packages
attrs.description:
Additional Deb Packages to install.</br>
See Netdata documentation for more information.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.

attrs.label: DNS Options
attrs.description:
DNS options for the container.</br>
Format: key:value</br>
Example: attempts:3

attrs.label: Netdata Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Netdata Config.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB dataset.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: The path to mount the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password to use for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain
attrs.description: The domain to use for the SMB share.

attrs.description: Containers where the label should be applied

attrs.description: CPUs limit for Netdata.

attrs.label: Memory (in MB)
attrs.description: Memory limit for Netdata.

1.3.13.readme:
Netdata

Netdata is a fast, easy monitoring and troubleshooting system.
